Detailed Description

The class SmsFactory is used to generate mobile originated Sms.

void SmsFactory::Reset (  BOOLEAN  reallocate = TRUE  ) 
 

Resets the whole SmsFactory, and reallocates internal buffer (if reallocate is TRUE).

Sms::Result SmsFactory::Send (  BOOLEAN  wait_for_response = TRUE,
GsmService  service = CircuitSwitched
) 
 

In the blocking-mode(wait_for_response = TRUE), there is only the Sms::Result as return parameter available. No further parameters, like the assigned reference-number or the short-message-failure-cause, are reported. These parameters will be available in the asynchronous-mode(wait_for_response = FALSE), by listening to the confirmation and rejection message. In the asynchronous-mode only the first Tpdu in the list is sent. The sending of all other Tpdu's respective the next one in the list is triggered by the method SetSendungResult, which has to be called after receiving the sending confirmation. The parameter service defines the service, which is used for sending the Tpdu.

INT SmsFactory::SetSendingResult (  Sms::Result  result,
const SmsReferenceNumber &  reference_number = 0xFF
) 
 

Is used only for the non-blocking send method (Send(FALSE)), to update the state and the reference number of the SMS. Furthermore this method triggers the sending of the next Tpdu in the list -> the method handles the iteration through the list of Tpdu's for sending means. The iteration is stopped, when the parameter result signals an error. The return-value provides the number of unsent Tpdu's in the list.

INT SmsFactory::SetSendingResult (  Sms::Result  last_sending_result,
Sms::Result &  subsequent_sending_result,
SmsReferenceNumber  reference_number = 0xFF
) 
 

Is used only for the non-blocking send method (Send(FALSE)), to update the state and the reference number of the SMS. Furthermore this method triggers the sending of the next Tpdu in the list -> the method handles the iteration through the list of Tpdu's for sending means. The iteration is stopped, when the parameter result signals an error.

Parameters:
last_sending_result input parameter for the retrieved sending result (via SmsSendConfirmMsg resp. SmsSendRejectMsg)
subsequent_sending_result output parameter, who describes the return-code of the internal call Send method, which is done as a subsequent sending (for concatenated SMS)
reference_number input parameter for the retrieved reference number (via SmsSendConfirmMsg resp. SmsSendRejectMsg), which will be assigned to the currently sent TPDU
Returns:
provides the number of unsent Tpdu's in the list.

Sms::Result SmsFactory::Store (   ) 
 

stores the Sms on the preferred storage media and returns if the store-request was successful. ADC methods SetInitialPrefferedStorageMedia and ChangePreferredStorageMedia of DataHandler shall be used to control where MT-SMS and MO-SMS shall be stored.

Sms::Result SmsFactory::Store (  const Sms::StorageType  storage_type  ) 
 

stores the Sms on Sim or Flash and returns if the store-request was successful.
